page.title: 13Hedges in the Guyzance Area.
page.content: The characteristic field boundary of the area is a hedge surmounting a wooden fence. The dominant tree in these hedges is hawthorn but this is supplemented by bramble,elder,dog rose,honeysuckle,sycamore,ash and elm. Hedges have been removed in places to make arable farming easier to carry out but in the main,hedges have been retained where the fields adjoin the roads.In most places a ditch exists between the hedge and road surface.Most farms cut their hedges using a tractor mounted shape-saw or flail.The autumn fruits of the hedgerow,haws,bramble,hips and elderberries provide food for local mammals and birds.The last three named fruits are used by humans in a number of recipes eg.wine and jelly.
